channel.title: Batman film premier shooting
channel.description:
At least 14 people have been killed in a shooting at a Batman film premiere in the US city of Denver. About 50 people have been injured in the incident, police say. Witnesses say a gunman wearing a gas mask opened fire at the cinema complex in Aurora, at a midnight showing of The Dark Knight Rises. There are reports the gunman released a smoke bomb during the incident. Police say they have one suspect in custody. Many ambulances are at the scene. The Swedish Medical Center, not the area's main hospital, told the BBC it had received three gunshot victims. A witness told 9News that during a shooting scene in the film he heard loud bangs and a lot of smoke and initially thought they were live special effects put on by the cinema. Projectiles came through the wall from the neighbouring theatre screening, the witness said. CNN quoted one witness saying: "A guy slowly making his way up the stairs and firing - picking random people."
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-18921492 so how are those concealed carry laws working out?

item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Also I am hearing that it wasn’t tear gas that he used, it was a smoke grenade which can cause tearing due to the smoke being so thick. I’m guessing not one person in that theater had ever been exposed to tear gas before so they just assumed because their eyes were watering it was tear gas.

item.title: Batman film premier shooting
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

jme:

And before you tell me that there’s no guns on the streets of europe, guns are extremely easy to obtain in europe. There’s a huge amount of illegal mail order gun services hidden on tor, almost all are based in europe/UK. Most will ship to other countries, with excellent success rates. Any nerd can find them.

there may be plenty of guns on the street, guns were after all legal in the UK for a time and still are today, and some places in Europe don’t completely ban guns however that isn’t necessarily the issue, much of Europe has an extremely small homicides per 100k people from guns even in European countries where people CAN carry guns legally

removing guns from a general population in any country is absolutely ridiculous, petty criminals (may) hand over their gun however organized criminals sure aren’t, look at Australia for one of countless examples

jme:

Uh, it would be just as hard to disarm a man with a knife, as it would with a gun. Whoever comes at him first is getting shot/stabbed. Luckily he can’t protect his backside while doing this and whoever is behind could take the opportunity to tackle him to the ground if possible. In either scenario, some people would be sacrificing themselves.

not to mention he was in full body armour, had a gas mask and threw teargas

I’d take my chances and run rather than get stabbed trying to disarm him

Read full topic

item.title: Batman film premier shooting
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

If guns were illegal, he’d just own a gun illegally. So imo it doesn’t make much difference.

And before you tell me that there’s no guns on the streets of europe, guns are extremely easy to obtain in europe. There’s a huge amount of illegal mail order gun services hidden on tor, almost all are based in europe/UK. Most will ship to other countries, with excellent success rates. Any nerd can find them.

I think USA is just kind of fucked when it comes to gun crime. It could be a culture thing and not really the legality of guns. Removing all of the guns would be ideal, but impossible. The closest they could do is offer massive cash incentives for handing in guns but that still wouldn’t work.

Crazy people on a shooting rampage can happen anywhere. There was one in here in Canada very recent, 2 people dead 23 wounded. There was the shooting and explosives in Norway. And probably all sorts that I haven’t heard of since that.

(I don’t have a strong opinion on any of this. I’ll leave it to the experts to decide gun laws)

TheBeanie:

Most americans are sound, but the ones that believe they are better than everybody else and their views are the only ones that should matter are fucking idiots.

I’m sure those people live in your country too. I tend to see this attitude in europe more than anywhere.

[quote=“Frell, post:29, topic:450438”][quote author=Niall link=topic=553321.msg4055325#msg4055325 date=1342888395]
‘if they used a knife they could easily be tackled’

err what?
[/quote]
Not hard to overwhelm 1 guy with a knife in a movie theater[/quote]

Uh, it would be just as hard to disarm a man with a knife, as it would with a gun. Whoever comes at him first is getting shot/stabbed. Luckily he can’t protect his backside while doing this and whoever is behind could take the opportunity to tackle him to the ground if possible. In either scenario, some people would be sacrificing themselves.

Read full topic

item.title: Batman film premier shooting
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:62, topic:450438”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=553321.msg4059276#msg4059276 date=1343275342]
But if everyone has a gun, then noone will be stupid enough to rip one out in the first place.
[/quote]

That is a very stupid comment, please read what you wrote again.

Humans have something called emotions which overtake the brain and often the human makes decisions that the rational brain would not do because they were overshadowed by the drive of the emotion. E.g.

“Bitch gawn and cheeeted on me dint sheee, lets cap her ass”

or

“Im a clever guy, I have an idea, a game I would like to play, I’m the joker and I’m going to fuck up your film”

Im sorry but it really angers me when people think that giving guns to every citizen is a good idea, it makes NO sense what so ever, not even for the personal defence effect. If you are worried about personal defence give people a low-power tazer enough to scare the attacker.[/quote]

Only in america would they think MORE is better.

Read full topic

Humans have something called emotions which overtake the brain and often the human makes decisions that the rational brain would not do because they were overshadowed by the drive of the emotion. E.g.

item.title: Batman film premier shooting
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Greeny:

[quote]In the three days after the shooting, applications for the background checks needed to buy a gun legally were up 43% on the previous week.

This is both hilarious and terrifying at the same time. I am so glad I don’t live over there right now.

All I can imagine is the next time this happens they all pull guns out and shoot each other. It’s not like it’s easy to tell who fired the first shot in an ambush situation (hell, trained soldiers are scared of ambushes) and they’re going to be looking for danger (another person with a gun).[/quote]
Such a tragic event would settle the gun law issue. Tragic but could help people in the future.

Read full topic

item.title: Batman film premier shooting
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:53, topic:450438”][quote author=Frell link=topic=553321.msg4057284#msg4057284 date=1343091351]
uhh

http://sphotos-a.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ash3/532432_424290114281305_705034457_n.jpg[/img]
[/quote]

not only do the swiss government train its citizens, it forces (yep!) them to training at least once per year! and who said gun control was bad?

but no that graphic is wrong, gun politics in switzerland is a little more than “everyone gets a gun and is trained in it” to the point where this statement is false, and without any source to the claim that switzerland has the lowest gun crime of any civilized country the picture should be dismissed out of hand

but hey, actual studies done suggest that switzerland doesn’t have say, the lowest gun homicide per 100,000 people in europe, let alone the civilised world (in which japan actually has the least)[/quote]

At least Switzerland is responsible and doesn’t send it’s people to be killed in wars. The swiss citizens enjoy going to the compulsory 3 months of yearly army service because they know they aren’t going to be killed and they get paid. Other countries have shit backwards. I reckon if one person dies in a war, that is one too many and war should be banned. Or at least pasteurized.
